DataElement.preferredName: Product Investigation Observation Performed Study Activity Target Anatomic Site Laterality Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The completed process of evaluating a product after it has been returned to the manufacturer or reprocessor. A coded value specifying the side of the body (or a paired organ) that is a target site for an observation. EXAMPLE(S): bilateral, left, right.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Product Investigation Observation Performed Study Activity Target Anatomic Site Laterality Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.:The act or process of a systematic and thorough examination; research, study; the process of inquiring into or following up, intended to develop facts.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.:Named locations of or within the body.:Dominant use or manifestations of one side of the body versus the other; referring to a side of the body or of a structure.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Product Investigation Observation Performed Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.:The act or process of a systematic and thorough examination; research, study; the process of inquiring into or following up, intended to develop facts.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.
The act or process of a systematic and thorough examination; research, study; the process of inquiring into or following up, intended to develop facts.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.:Named locations of or within the body.:Dominant use or manifestations of one side of the body versus the other; referring to a side of the body or of a structure.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.
Named locations of or within the body.
Dominant use or manifestations of one side of the body versus the other; referring to a side of the body or of a structure.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
